meta_description: YAA offers immersive exhibitions, classes, camps, art workshops, birthday parties, and support for communities in need of art.
hours_text:
# Visit us

Young At Art (YAA) is inside Broward Mall. YAA Main Museum is open for the public to enjoy playful interactive exhibitions and art making experiences with museum admission. YAA Fun Zone is for admin offices and studio art classes.

8000 W Broward Blvd Ste 1208, Plantation, FL 33388

Open: Wed – Sun: 11am – 6pm

Admission Closes at 5:30pm

Admission | Children & Adults $12 each

Children Under 2 Years of Age are Free.

Free for Members, [Join Today](http://web.archive.org/web/20260111001555/https://youngatartmuseum.org/join)! 

[ Sensory Map ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260111001555/http://www.youngatartmuseum.org/yaaathome/images/Sensory-Map-2021.jpg)

[ Social Narrative ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260111001555/http://www.youngatartmuseum.org/yaaathome/pdf/YAASocialNarrative2021.pdf)

Getting Here

Museum Hours

Facilities & Access

Getting Here

### Traveling By Car

Broward Mall is conveniently located at the corner of South University Drive and West Broward Boulevard.

  * From I-75 South, take Exit 19 to merge onto I-595 E. Take Exit 4 to S. Pine Island Rd. Turn right at West Broward Blvd/SR-842E.
  * From I-95 North/South, take Exit 24 to merge onto I-595 W. Take Exit 4 and make a right toward S. Pine Island Road. Turn right at W. Broward Blvd/SR-842E.

Closest entry to Young At Art **MAIN MUSEUM is** at the far northeast side of the mall, north of Buffalo Wild Wings and the circular fountain. Within the mall the YAA Main Museum is located across from **...

About this capture

COLLECTED BY

Organization: [Archive Team](https://archive.org/details/archiveteam)

Formed in 2009, the Archive Team (not to be confused with the archive.org Archive-It Team) is a rogue archivist collective dedicated to saving copies of rapidly dying or deleted websites for the sake of history and digital heritage. The group is 100% composed of volunteers and interested parties, and has expanded into a large amount of related projects for saving online and digital history. 

History is littered with hundreds of conflicts over the future of a community, group, location or business that were "resolved" when one of the parties stepped ahead and destroyed what was there. With the original point of contention destroyed, the debates would fall to the wayside. Archive Team believes that by duplicated condemned data, the conversation and debate can continue, as well as the richness and insight gained by keeping the materials. Our projects have...
